summary.purpose: Defines the main Table component, the TableProvider context wrapper, and the TableContext used to share table state (search, sort, filter, pagination) among all sub-components.
summary.problem_solved: Provides a fully-featured, configurable data table with built-in search (with debounced multi-term '+' syntax), column sorting, column filtering, export-to-Excel support, row-count limiting, summary rows, and deep-equal memoisation via React.memo to avoid unnecessary re-renders.

symbols.name: TableContext
symbols.description: React context created with createContext that holds the merged TableProps and TableProviderType state. Consumed by child sub-components (TableHead, TableBody, etc.) via the useTableContext hook.

symbols.name: TableProvider
symbols.description: Context provider component that initialises all table state (sort, filter, search, display-toggle) using custom hooks, computes the derived dataToRender (filtered/sorted/paginated), and makes everything available via TableContext to descendant components.

details.rendered_ui_description: Renders a flex-column container div wrapping its children, with optional gap styling when toolbar elements (search, export, optional element) are present. Sets the CSS direction property from props.

symbols.name: TableBase
symbols.description: Internal (non-exported) presentational component that composes the full table layout: a container header row with Search, ExportToExcel, DisplayAllRowsButton, and MaxRowsLabel; the scrollable table container with TableHead and TableBody; and an optional Summary footer. Wrapped by TableProvider.

details.rendered_ui_description: Renders the complete table UI with an optional toolbar row (search input, export button, display-all toggle, optional custom element, max-rows label), followed by a scrollable table with sticky header and data rows, and an optional summary/totals footer.

symbols.name: Table
symbols.description: The primary exported Table component. It is a React.memo wrapper around TableBase using lodash isEqual for deep prop comparison to prevent unnecessary re-renders when table data or configuration hasn't actually changed.

details.rendered_ui_description: Memoised version of the full table, rendering the complete data table with search, sort, filter, export, pagination, and summary features.

symbols.name: areEqual
symbols.description: Custom comparison function for React.memo that performs a deep equality check on TableProps using lodash isEqual, preventing re-renders when props are deeply equal.

known_gaps: The import of TableSCN from '../ui/table' is present but not visibly used in the rendered JSX â€” it may be used elsewhere or is a leftover import.
The import of textNumbersRegex from 'src/helpers/forms' is imported but not visibly used in this file.
